result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary Stow Buehner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Switchblade Knife, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Defendant will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.

Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Defendant shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of this Agreement.

timeConds.notes: Defendant shall complete 40 hours of community service within 9 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and provide the Monroe County Justice Department, Justice Program Coordinator or designee, with verification of said hours.

DEFENDANT TO PERFORM AND COMPLETE 20 HOURS OF COMMUNITY SERVICE TO BE COMPLETED BY MAY 4, 2018.  DEFENDANT MUST SEND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETED COMMUNITY SERVICE TO JUDGE.

DEFENDANT ELIGIBLE FOR EXPUNGEMENT IF FINE AND COSTS ARE PAID IN FULL, COMMUNITY SERVICE HAS BEEN COMPLETED AND DEFENDANT HAS NO NEW CHARGES.  DEFENDANT TO CONTACT THE JUDGE BY LETTER REQUESTING EXPUNGEMENT.
